title: Designing an Online Training Program Development Protocol: ADDIE Model-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool proficiency and professional field (medical/legal/technical) work experience
context.additional_context: Systematic design and evaluation of online training program development protocols following the ADDIE model by small learner groups in a digital-device-provided environment, organized by project units.

learning_goals: Learners can independently create an online training program development protocol using the five stages of the ADDIE model (Analysis, Design, Development, Implementation, Evaluation).
Design the content structure based on target learner analysis (age, expertise, learning environment) and multidisciplinary literature review.
Develop an online training platform applicable to real-world cases (medical/legal/technical fields) through project-based learning (PBL).
Propose measures to continuously improve the effectiveness and usability of the developed training program through formative evaluation.

resources: Practical Case Database for Medical/Legal/Technical Fields

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
